meanings.definition: To confine or restrict to a particular place or area.
meanings.sent1: I will localize the toys to the toy box.
meanings.sent2: The library decided to localize their collection to books only.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to localize all the socks in one drawer.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to localize in the small room, echoing off the walls.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's voice seemed to localize in my mind, reminding me of the lesson.

meanings.sent1: The restaurant aims to localize their menu with regional dishes.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to localize their marketing strategy for each city.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes always localize to the quirks of the town.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness seemed to localize in the community, spreading warmth to all.
meanings.sent5: The music festival tried to localize the event by featuring local bands.
